name: Interests
instructions: Choose the activity or statement that you prefer. [cite_start]There are no right or wrong answers. [cite: 147, 148]

questions.text: Which would you prefer? [cite: 150]

options.text: Building a working model of a dam for a science fair. [cite: 151]
Researching the causes of water pollution in the Ganga river. [cite: 152]

questions.text: Which would you prefer?

options.text: Writing a computer program to solve a mathematical problem. [cite: 153]
Designing the cover page for the school's annual magazine.

questions.text: Which would you prefer? [cite: 154]

options.text: Conducting a chemistry experiment in the lab. [cite: 155]
Composing a song for the annual day function. [cite: 156]

questions.text: Which would you prefer? [cite: 157]

options.text: Fixing a broken mobile phone or a household appliance. [cite: 158]
Reading about the latest discoveries from ISRO. [cite: 159]

questions.text: Which would you prefer? [cite: 160]

options.text: Sketching a portrait or painting a landscape. [cite: 161]
Analyzing data from a survey to find a pattern. [cite: 162]

questions.text: I prefer subjects that have clear, logical answers, like Physics or Maths. [cite: 163]
I enjoy hands-on activities, like gardening, cooking, or carpentry. [cite: 164]
I find myself lost in thought, trying to understand complex theories or ideas. [cite: 165]
Expressing myself through art, music, or writing is important to me. [cite: 166]
I would rather work with tools and machines than with people or ideas. [cite: 167]
Which would you prefer? [cite: 169]

options.text: Organizing a fundraising event for a social cause. [cite: 170]
Creating a detailed budget for the event. [cite: 171]

questions.text: Which would you prefer? [cite: 172]

options.text: Leading the school's student council and making important decisions. [cite: 173]
Keeping a systematic record of all council meetings and activities. [cite: 174]

questions.text: Which would you prefer? [cite: 175]

options.text: Teaching or mentoring junior students who are struggling with a subject. [cite: 176]
Managing the school library's database of books. [cite: 177]

questions.text: Which would you prefer? [cite: 178]

options.text: Persuading people to join a new club you've started in school. [cite: 179]
Following a set of instructions carefully to assemble a piece of furniture. [cite: 180]

questions.text: Which would you prefer? [cite: 181]

options.text: Helping a friend who is going through a tough time. [cite: 182]
Creating a timetable for your study group to follow. [cite: 183]

questions.text: I enjoy working with numbers and data and am very detail-oriented. [cite: 184, 185]
I like taking charge and motivating others to achieve a common goal. [cite: 186]
I find great satisfaction in helping others and contributing to society. [cite: 187]
I am good at convincing people and negotiating to get what I want. [cite: 188]
I am most comfortable when I have a clear, structured routine to follow. [cite: 188]
